Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk rhncfg
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: Red Hat Network Tools rhnpush bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: Red Hat Network Tools provide programs and libraries that allow your system to use provisioning, monitoring, and configuration management capabilities provided by Red Hat Network and Red Hat Network Satellite. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the spacewalk-client-cert utility required by the spacewalk-fips-tool was not present in the Red Hat Network Tools channel. With this update, spacewalk-client-cert has been added. (BZ#1191205) Under certain circumstances, comparing configuration files and directories terminated unexpectedly with the "Fatal error in Python code occured" error. This bug has been fixed and comparison operations now work correctly. (BZ#1192069) All users of Red Hat Network Tools are advised to upgrade to this updated package, which fixes these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
